qas.question: Which movement is considered to be a dividing line between ancient thought and classical physics?
Who made the heliocentric model popular?
Johannes Kepler created a model of what?
What did Johannes Kepler's model suggest about the planets?

context: <a0_0>The scientific revolution<a0_0/> is a convenient boundary between ancient thought and classical physics. <a1_0>Nicolaus Copernicus<a1_0/> revived the heliocentric model of the solar system described by Aristarchus of Samos. This was followed by the first known model of <a2_0>planetary motion<a2_0/> given by Johannes Kepler in the early 17th century, which proposed that <a3_0>the planets follow elliptical orbits<a3_0/>, with the Sun at one focus of the ellipse. Galileo ("<a4_0>Father of Modern Physics<a4_0/>") also made use of experiments to validate physical theories, a key element of the scientific method.
